intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Ah, Lord/Lady Corrin, I see you've returned to us safe and sound.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes, Iago. We've just now made it back. It's good to be home. I haven't any time to waste, though. I'd like to report to Father right away.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Yes, of course. I'm sure you have much to discuss.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: By the way, what's with all the commotion around here? Did something happen?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: There's a small rebellion in Cheve. Nothing your royal head should worry about. Our soldiers are preparing to quash it as we speak, before it gets out of hand.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Another rebellion...

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: I'm sure King Garon can fill you in on the specifics if you so please. He's waiting for you in the reception room. I would advise against keeping him waiting.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Excellent. I shall go immediately.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: ... Hmph, little snake. Parading around the castle like nothing happened. I suppose the Macarath plan wasn't severe enough. Live and learn. I'll just have to make sure my next plan isn't so easy for him to slither out of.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Welcome back, child. I hear you have once again fulfilled my orders flawlessly. You're growing stronger right before my eyes. I am proud of you, my son/daughter.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Father.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: But we must never rest on our laurels. Cheve requires immediate attention. Perhaps Iago already told you, but there's been a rebellion there. It's still small, but it won't remain so. Cheve is known for it's skilled knights. We cannot afford to underestimate their prowess on the battlefield. I'm sending our standing army to strike them down before this gets out of control. I'm trusting you, Corrin, to lead them to victory.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You want ME to lead our standing army against the Chevois knights?!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: That is correct.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm honored by this opportunity, Father. I truly am. It's just... I don't have the necessary expertise to lead our troops against such a talented army. Surely there is someone else who would be better suited for this-

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Are you defying me, boy/girl?! I am entrusting you with this mission because I believe you can succeed. Do not disappoint me, my son/daughter.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But, Father... *sigh* Understood. I won't let you down. I will suppress the rebellion in Cheve.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I have high hopes for you, Corrin. You are dismissed.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Father, wait! If I may have just a moment of your time, I have something to report.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Well? Out with it.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Azura, the Nohrian princess who was taken by the Hoshidans, has returned to us.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: What?!

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Greetings, your majesty.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Azura...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes, milord. It is I.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Hmm, how unexpected. I never thought I'd see your face again. If you wish, you may go with Corrin to suppress the rebellion. Think of it as a chance to see more of your homeland.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: That is all. Bring back good news, my children.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Father was acting... strangely. Even colder and more distant then usual. You're his long-lost daughter, and yet he barely spoke a word to you...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: It's quite all right, Corrin. I didn't expect much.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But he's your father! It's not right. He should be more... I don't know...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: It's fine. Please don't worry about it. To be honest, I never thought I'd see him again. So in a way, the few words we exchanged exceeded my expectations.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Azura...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: *sigh* I wonder what's really going on with Father. And Azura, for that matter... They've been separated for a lifetime, yet they barely spoke to each other. Something about it bothers me, though I can't put my finger on it. Ah well, I haven't time to dwell. I must prepare to depart with the army. Speaking of, I'm pretty sure this is where the soldiers gather to rest...

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: Prince/Princess Corrin! Milord/Milady!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Hans! What do you want?

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: So it's true. I heard a rumor that our young prince/princess would be leading us. Congratulations on the honor, prince/princess Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Enough with the flattery, Hans. Did you need me for something?

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: Yes, I've been awaiting your arrival. As a member of the standing army, I will be accompanying you to Cheve. I've been ordered to aid you in whatever task you you request of me.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You? Helping me? And I'm to trust you even after you tried to kill me at the Bottomless Canyon?

intro.speaker: Hans
intro.line: A thousand apologies, milord/milady. I pray you can find it in your heart to forgive me. King Garon commanded I attack you so as to test your abilities. You should be pleased to know you far exceeded his expectations. Despite being a Hoshidan royal, you chose to side with our great kingdom of Nohr. You chose to remain with your Nohrian siblings and the man who raised you. Everyone at the castle was overjoyed. It greatly improved morale! I have every faith that you'll lead us well and to victory, milord/milady.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: So this is Cheve... Um... Odd. There doesn't seem to be any fighting at the moment.

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Perhaps they've returned to their safe houses for the night. We should do the same. We'll be better prepared for tomorrow if we get some rest. I know of an abandoned place nearby. Shall we head that way?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Sounds great.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Hello, brother/sister dear. I've been waiting for you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Huh?!

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Corrin!

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Damn, so close. I was aiming for your traitorous head.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Takumi! Are you insane? You could have killed-

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Stay back, Corrin! It's too dangerous.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Hiding behind your fake sister, are you? You've reached a new low. It matters not. I have an army of soldiers at my command.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Stop this, Takumi. This doesn't concern you or Hoshido. I've come to peacefully suppress the rebellion in Cheve. Please, lay down your bow and return to Hoshido where you belong.

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: Bah, I knew you hounds would try to stop our righteous rebellion. All the more reason to stand our ground!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I seem to have angered you, stranger. May I ask who you are?

intro.speaker: Scarlet
intro.line: The name's Scarlet. I'm part of the resistance here in Cheve. I've had my people tracking you ever since you left Nohr. Our Hoshidan allies were all too grateful to receive word of your whereabouts.

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Turning your back on the kingdom of Nohr. Tsk tsk. Quite the little traitor, aren't you?

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Traitor? Ha! Nohrian logic never ceases to amuse me. Scarlet did the same thing as Corrin, only SHE chose the right side. Joining the enemy and laying a trap for your own countrymen... Sound familiar?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Quiet, you! Don't say such awful things about my brother/sister, or you'll be sorry! Corrin didn't betray anyone! He's/She's the best person in the world!

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Ugh, who allowed this little brat to speak? How irritating.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Elise!!

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: The sight of that Nohrian brat makes me sick. Just die already. Scarlet and I won't stop until we free Cheve from Nohrian oppression. I plan to eliminate all who stand in our way. It's you against us, Corrin. Isn't that just what King Garon wants? For all of us to fight to the death?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You're wrong, Takumi! If you could only see beyond your own hatred of me. If we could just talk things out, we could end this war peacefully. Fighting isn't the only way. How many more people must die before you see that?

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: QUIET, NOHRIAN SCUM! I've had enough of your lies to last a lifetime. I'm going to kill you all and bring peace back to Hoshido! All troops, prepare for battle! Destroy the Nohrian army!!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Takumi!

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: I'll... kill you all... Y-yes... If I kill the Nohrians... surely the pain... the pain in my head will go away...

visit.speaker: Child
visit.line: You're from Nohr, aren't you?  Have you come to kill us? Huh? There's a battle going on? Oh, OK. I'll lock up tight. Thanks for the warning. In fact... take this. Might come in handy.

visit.speaker: Boy
visit.line: You're with the Nohrian army, eh? You enforcing a new curfew, or what? I'll just stay inside. I was about to hit the hay anyway. Here, take this before you go.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: My family and I know full well it's useless to fight the Nohrian army. Here, have this. Anything to help end this war quickly. I only hope that King Garon eventually learns to rule with compassion...

visit.speaker: Girl
visit.line: Visitors from the Nohrian army? This late? Oh dear, you must be ever so tired. Our rebels feel differently, but the people of Cheve are loyal to Nohr. Please believe me! Here, take this as proof of our loyalty.

boss.speaker: Orochi
boss.line: Hee hee, you're afraid of my magic, aren't you? You should be.

boss.speaker: Orochi
boss.line: How could I lose?! My fortune said... I would win...today's battle...

boss.speaker: Reina
boss.line: I will grant you the most divine death if you'll let me hear you scream...

boss.speaker: Reina
boss.line: Such a pity... I was looking forward to watching...the light leave your eyes...

boss.speaker: Scarlet
boss.line: I won't let Nohr oppress my people any longer. For freedom!

boss.speaker: Scarlet
boss.line: Though I fall here...Cheve...will never bow down...

boss.speaker: Takumi
boss.line: I will not lose this time. Death to Nohr!

boss.speaker: Takumi
boss.line: It can't be... I'm so much stronger now! How could this...happen...

battle.speaker: Charlotte
battle.line: Ugh, these jokesters are a real pain in my rear. Why are they making such a racket this late at night? I need my beauty rest! I bet it's those Chevois jerks again. I've had it up to my ears with them. Can't they all just drop dead already?! Benny, I'm talkin' over here!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Um, excuse me, but are you two with the rebels?

battle.speaker: Charlotte
battle.line: How DARE you! We're proud Nohrian soldiers here to defend our border! Geez, the nerve of some people. Comparing us to those savages! Ain't that right, Benny?

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Ah, my apologies. I didn't realize you were Nohrian border guards. I'm Corrin, prince/princess of Nohr. I'm here to suppress this rebellion.

battle.speaker: Charlotte
battle.line: HUH?! You're a p-prince? Oh... Please forgive me, milord! Where ARE my manners?! I must have been bitten by an evil little fairy, hee hee. I'm so VERY sorry.

battle.speaker: Benny
battle.line: Please forgive my rude companion, milord. She's... eccentric.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: No need to apologize. But what are you two doing here? Have you come to help us?

battle.speaker: Benny
battle.line: ... No milord. The rebels were being loud, so Charlotte wanted to kick their—

battle.speaker: Charlotte
battle.line: Benny, you silly-billy! Don't joke around with our rich prince friend here. OF COURSE we're here to help you. I'm a delicate little flower, but I know how to battle. Why bother living if we can't help our gorgeous prince in his time of need? Ain't that... I mean, isn't that right, my dear Benny?

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Well, you both look strong and able, so we'd be grateful for your help. All I ask is that you do all you can to spare the lives of our enemies.

battle.speaker: Charlotte
battle.line: Of course, my prince! Little flowers like me are ill-equipped to kill anyway. Oh, goodness! I haven't properly introduced myself, have I? Silly me! I'm Charlotte, hee hee. This mammoth here is my totally platonic friend, Benny. It's nice to make your royal acquaintance! I'll do everything I can to make you happy.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: It's, um, nice to meet you as well. If you'll excuse me...

battle.speaker: Charlotte
battle.line: ... SCORE! We're in the big leagues now, Benny my boy. I'm this close to landing the catch of a lifetime, heh heh!

battle.speaker: Ruffian
battle.line: All of the soldiers are going at it pretty hard. Heh, all the better. A chaotic battle is the perfect time to take the villagers for all they're worth...

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: NO! How could I lose... Not again...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It's over, Takumi. You can't keep fighting. Return to Hoshido with your troops.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Dammit. Why?! Why can't I beat you? You abandoned Hoshido... stood by and watched Mother die... betrayed us all... Why can't I have the justice I deserve?!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Takumi...

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: As you said, I must retreat for now. But next time will be different. Next time HAS to be different... I'll never forgive you, Corrin... I won't rest until I've killed you myself. Some day soon, I'll make you pay for your sins. I swear on my mother's grave.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: ...That is not the Takumi I once knew. He's changed.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What do you mean? How so?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Takumi never accepted me as his sister like the others, but he was always kind. He's not the type to raise his voice or threaten to hurt anyone. I can't explain it, but it's like he's a different person...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Do you think... it's because I betrayed Hoshido? Could that be the cause?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: To be honest, it's very likely you choosing Nohr played a part. But it still doesn't add up. He's so crazed and focused on Nohr's destruction... I can't help but wonder if that's really Takumi.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Huh? Of course that's Takumi. Who else would it-
AAAAAARGHHHH!!!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Someone's in pain! What's going on over there?!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: It's getting louder. Let's hurry!

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: HA HA HA!! Death to all who defy the great king of Nohr!

end.speaker: Boy
end.line: Please... no... Gaaaah... !!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hans! Stop this, now! What do you think you're doing?!

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: Don't worry, milord/milady, I'm saving some of these rats for you. You're just in time to help us take out the trash that started this rebellion.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Are you insane!? We don't kill for the sake of killing! And these are innocent villagers! They're not even soldiers!

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: Villagers are just soldiers who haven't grabbed a sword yet, heh heh. If we let them live, it'll come back to haunt us when we least expect it.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That's no excuse to take innocent lives. Stop this at once! As Prince/Princess of Nohr, I order you to drop your blade and let these people go!

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: Forgive me, milord/milady, but the orders come straight from Lord Garon. You may be a prince/princess, and our leader, but the King's word is law.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: F-father ordered you... to do this terrible thing...?

end.speaker: Hans
end.line: He did. My apologies. Now if you'll excuse me, I'd like to wrap up here so we can get back home. Feel free to find somewhere quieter to rest until the dirty work is over, milord/milady.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hans, wait! Stop this madness! HANS!!

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: ... This is a truly horrid sight to behold, my darling brother/sister. I wish things could be different.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Camilla...

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: I'm sorry, but I just found out the injured Hoshidan soldiers have already been killed. And that rebel... what was her name... Scarlet? Yes, the poor thing. They killed her in such a way... Well, they clearly meant to make an example of her.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Gods, no... but Scarlet would have listened to us if we had just talked things out. Now we'll never have that chance... Why, Camilla? Who wants to live in a world where precious life is destroyed on a whim? Is this the world Father is building? Is this what I've been fighting for?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I don't understand. I can never understand. How could Father do this? Where is the justice? The respect for life? The common decency?! Tell me, Camilla...

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: Corrin... I know you're upset, but we need to report back to Father. He'll be angry if we keep him waiting. I'll summon a messenger.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Camilla! How can you be so calm at a time like this?

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: I'm sorry, Corrin. I don't have the answers you're looking for. I don't know why Father makes some of the decisions he makes. I never have. I do know that even as his blood kin, he wouldn't hesitate to kill me if I disobeyed. If you value your life, as I do... bury your feelings, at least for now. I know it's hard to do that while looking around at what's happening here... But I'm afraid it's your only option. If you'll excuse me, I must hurry.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Camilla... I'm sorry, but I can't do that. I can't accept that this is the Nohrian way. Something must be done...
